Description: Ostracon, large section (two fragments joined) of the upper portion of a buff-coloured pottery wine-jar with convex body and slightly flaring neck or mouth, the fabric is grey in section and contains many small white inclusions, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of one line of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as year 2 wine of the estate of the Greatest of Seers.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393463) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393463)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Estate of the Greatest of Seers (historic)
